column3: I can't believe we've never done this before
That was a half an hour
Y'know, I don't like to brag about it, but I give the best massages
All right, then massage me up right nice
It's so good I don't know what I've done to deserve it
I'm telling you, she gives the worst massages ever
Okay, it was like she was torturing me for information
And I wanted to give it up I just—I didn't know what it was
Chandler, if it really hurts that bad you should just tell her
Look, for the first time in my life I'm in a real relationship
Okay, I'm not gonna screw that up by y'know, telling the truth
This would be the place where you explain the hat
Yeah, look there's this play all right
And I'm up for the part of this real cool like suave international guy
So I figure that everyone at the audition is gonna be wearing this kinda y'know, ultra-hip, high fashion stuff
And you're gonna make them all disappear
Yeah, like you could find something as sophisticated as this
Joey, if you wanna look good, why don't you just come down to the store
Umm, well, only okay because I just got back from, from the hospital
I'm okay, but umm, my Grandma sorta died
It's okay, I mean she had a really incredible life
And it's not like I'm never gonna see her again, y'know she's gonna visit
Well maybe, maybe she's with us right now
Yeah, her first day on a new spiritual plane and she's gonna come to the coffeehouse
I just saw two people having sex in a car right outside
Ohh my God, I'm so sorry
Actually y'know what, it's kinda cool
'Cause it's like y'know, one life ends and another begins
Not the way they're doing it
Well umm, okay we were in the market and she bent down to get some yogurt and she just never came back up again
The last thing she said to me was; "Okay dear, you go get the eggs and I'm gonna get the yogurt and we'll meet at the checkout counter
We will meet at the checkout counter
Okay now Joey, y'know that since you're returning all of this stuff right after the audition you're gonna have to wear underwear
All right, then you'd better show me some of that too then
It looks like a women's purse
Trust me, all the men are wearing them in the spring catalog
See look, men, carrying the bag
See look, women, carrying the bag
But it is odd how a women's purse looks good on me, a man
I had sex a couple days ago
Well, I ain't gonna say no to that
Umm, well I sorta have some bad news, can I come in
Okay, umm, we're having a memorial service tomorrow
Look, are you coming to memorial service or not
You look just like your son Mrs
Are you referring to my man's bag
At first, I thought it just looked good, but it's practical too
It's got compartments for all your stuff
Joey, what are you doing with the bag
You're audition is not until tomorrow
Yeah, but sandwich time is right now
Joey, y'know you get any mustard on that bag, you can't return it
All right, then you owe me $350
Do you take Vasa or Mustercard
All right relax, look I'll pay you with the money from the acting job I am definitely gonna get thanks to you
Thank you so much for coming
Well, okay look, here's your umm, 3-D glasses and Reverend Pong will tell you when to put them on
Hey, how are you holding up
My Grandma had the exact same bag
Here, I brought you some flowers
Pulling flowers out it makes the bag look a lot more masculine
So how did you know Francis
My name uh, actually is-is Joe
And thank you so much for coming
Hey you guys, check it out
It's like it's coming right at me
He said, "Nice to meet you Glenda
"  Well, obviously I couldn't give him my real name
Come on, you saw the way he ran out of here
He's gonna stick around and talk to the daughter he abandoned
What did you say to him
Well, I said, I told him y'know, that I was the executor person of Francis' will and that I needed to talk to him so I'm gonna meet him at the coffee house later
All right, well, I just can't think about that right now
I just wanna say good-bye to my Grandma
All right, let's go say good-bye
Ahhh, I think you look great
That bag is gonna get you that part
And a date with a man
And it's as handy as it is becoming
Now, just because you don't understand something, doesn't make it wrong
So from now on you guys are gonna have to get used to the fact that Joey,  comes with a bag
All right, I'd better go too
I have to go talk to my dad
Ooh, Pheebs, what are you gonna say
Are you gonna tell him who you are
Umm, no, not at first 'cause I-I don't want to freak him out
Well, but aren't you pissed at him
I mean this guy abandoned you
I gotta tell you if this were me, this guy would be in some serious physical danger
I mean I-I-I'd walk in there and I'd be like, "Yo, dad
You and me outside right now
Well, at least you scared someone
Y'know it's funny, you'd think I'd be angry
I mean, you'd think I'd wanna rip his tiny little head off
Phoebe, you do seem a little tense
Why are you doing that to me
As a masseuse and a human, I'm begging you, never do that to anyone
I used to give them to Rachel all the time before she got allergic
I can't believe you'd do that
Well, maybe he just didn't want to hurt your feelings
But the minute we start to lie to each other…  And by 'we' I mean society
Well, you must be new here
Why don't we get a table and I'll buy you a drink
Could you, could you try it without the purse
Well, you must be new here
Maybe we should—I'm sorry, can I ask you something
Well, first it's not a purse
I mean if-if you're thinking it's a woman's bag, it's not
All right look, let me show you the catalog
Umm, do you sell these bags
Yeah but I didn’t read anything
Listen, I just wanted to apologize about this afternoon and the whole massage thing
Look, we're supposed to be honest with each other
I-I just wish you could tell me—just say, "I don't like your massages
Okay, but now see you're crying
I'm crying about something that happened at work
My boyfriend said he didn't like my massages
It's okay, you don't have to be the best at everything
You don't know me at all
Okay, you give the worst massages in the world
You give the best bad massages
If anybody was looking for the best bad massage and they were thinking to themselves, "Who's the best of that
" They'd have to go to you
So you're saying like umm, if there was an award for the best bad massage, well who would get that
And you'd get all the votes
So maybe they could umm, call the award the Monica
Umm, thank you for meeting with me
Umm, all righty, before we get started I just—I need you to state for the official record that you are in fact Frank Buffay
So, what did Francis leave me
Well, that's why you wanted me to come, right
She left you umm,  this lipstick
It's huh, well it's  oh it's—ew used
I have just a few questions to ask so I'm going to get out my official forms
Okay, so, question 1) You and uh, you were married to Francis' daughter Lilly, is that correct
Okay, umm, question 2) Umm, did that marriage end A
In the total abandonment of her and her two children
Well then I guess then I-I would I would have to say C
Or you're just a selfish, irresponsible bad, bad man
Y'know, I don't think I want the lipstick that much
But umm… Oh, would you do me a favor
And umm, would you, would you give Lilly that, please
Well Lilly, when you see Lilly would you give her that, that note
Because I wanted to talk to her at the memorial but, well I pictured her getting mad at me the way you got mad at me and I well, I chickened out
So, uh, I wrote her that note, would you give it to her please
But you-you-you came to see Lilly
Well, if she isn't then cremating her was a big mistake
What about, what about the girls
Well, Ursula is a waitress and-and she lives in Soho
And Phoebe,  is on this couch
Yep, lipstick and a daughter, big day for you
I just, I-I-I-I don’t, I don’t know what to say
I just can't believe that you're my daughter, you're so pretty
Well, that's neither here nor there
So would it, would it make you feel better if I said I was very, very sorry that I left
Y'know what, it doesn’t matter what you say it's not gonna make a difference anyway, so you can just go
Well, y'know in my defense I was a lousy father
I burned the formula and I put your diapers on backwards
I mean, I made up a song to sing you to sleep, but that made you cry even more
Let's see, how did it, how did it go
I just, I y'know, I'm not very good at this
Hey man, how did the audition go
Estelle said I didn't get it
Joey you were so ready for it
Yeah, I thought so too but, she said the casting people had some problems with me
Well to tell you the truth, they uh,  they had a problem with the bag
It was a stupid play anyway
Y'know, Joey, I think it's time to give up the bag
I don't wanna give up the bag
I don't have to give up the bag
Oh, you think I should give up the bag
Honey wait, Joey, I’m sorry I mean as terrific as I think you are with it…
…I just don't know if the world is ready for you and your bag
I can't believe I'm hearing this
I'm not saying that you shouldn’t have a bag, I just—it's just there are other bags that are a little less umm,  controversial
